title: Git: Support Co-Authored-By

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Feature Request Github introduced a convention where the commit message contains a list of co-authors, for use when pairing. Example: ``` commit 032db38255275dd7372f575e3d06947c878ef4c6 Author: Tommy Brunn Date: Thu May 17 10:21:16 2018 +0200 Encode int64 Co-Authored-By: Tulio Ornelas ``` Both Github and Atom then displays both authors whenever they are showing author information. See http://blog.atom.io/2018/04/18/atom-1-26.html#github-package-improvements-1 for an example of what it looks like in Atom. VS Code version: Code 1.23.1 (d0182c3417d225529c6d5ad24b7572815d0de9ac, 2018-05-10T16:03:31.083Z) OS version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

title: 20000+ characters not syntax highlighting
body:
<!--
Do you have a question? Please ask it on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode.

For bug reports, please fill in the details below. For feature requests, please describe the desired feature.
-->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.23.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (latest)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste in an xml or json or whatever you want with 20000+ characters

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Hello, I know that there is a 20k limit, so this is less of a bug, and more of a desired feature. It would be nice if it told the user "Hey this file is huge and that is why it is not syntax highlighting" then maybe you could tell it to ignore the 20k count and just highlight it all regardless of the time it takes. Then you keep your performance as well as allow it to work anyway.

This came up for me because I wanted to check a large xml for a value and wanted the syntax highlighting to help read it, but it simply didn't highlight, so I started deleting characters until I got down to 19999.

It would have been nice to at least know WHY it wasn't working, or allow me to tell it to simply work. It would also be nice to be able to set that 20k to something higher optionally.

title: Feature request: Allow Code Outline in Minimap location
body:
I'm using the VS Code insiders build, which has Code Outline built in. I loved this feature from Nuclide, but in its current incarnation it's not as useful as it could be (to me). I have to choose now between file tree (or git or any other of course) sidebar and Code Outline, but I'd prefer to always have it next to my code.

My idea was to allow what is now the Minimap to use different "widgets" (sorry, I've never developed for VS Code so I don't know the correct terminology), so the Code Outline view could live there instead of the (minimally useful Minimap).

title: Feature request: Treat the Chinese text as a Chinese sequence when using`Ctrl+Left/Right`

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Now the VSCode treats a long Chinese text as one “word”. Each time use `Ctrl+Left/Right`, it will move the cursor to the begin or end.

The feature request is that treat the Chinese text as a Chinese sequence, then each `Ctrl+Left/Right`, it just move one step. This act is the system text program default.

Example: (use `|` as the cursor )
```
|本文的学习公式
// Ctrl+Right
本文的学习公式|
```

Expected:
```
|本文的学习公式
// Ctrl+Right
本|文的学习公式
// Ctrl+Right
本文|的学习公式
// Ctrl+Right
本文的|学习公式
```

(Of course, It would be better if it can support Word Segmentation.)

title: Allow both "onFocusChange" and "afterDelay" for "files.autoSave"
body:
It would be nice to have both options enabled simultaneously.
I want rare saves during I'm typing code in the editor and instant save after I switched to the browser to see my changes in action.

Example:
```js
  "files.autoSave": ["onFocusChange", "afterDelay"],
  "files.autoSaveDelay": 10000,
```

Vote if you like this.

title: Move selection - Alt + arrow key

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Would you add ability to move selected part of line (not whole line) by Alt + arrow key - if none selection move line (this works), if part of line is selected - move selected part? Thanks.

title: Add commands to outline elements
body: The outline view should offer commands that can be run straight from an element. E.g. rename but also triggering things like find references et al. Similar to the editor-context-menu this could be made open for contributions

title: Alternative locations for the outline view
body:
The outline view lives inside the file explorer and while it can be re-arranges in there it cannot be dragged into its own view. Alternative locations could be:

1. a standalone viewlet, 
2. inside another viewlets, 
3. the bottom panel, or 
4. as a re-arrangable view that can be docked anywhere in the UI (like most others have it).

title: Bot: improve duplicate message

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
When an issue is closed as a duplicate by the bot, the bot should take into account the other labels on the issue and give a helpful message to the user to easily find the original issue. The message should contain a link to the search query of issues with the mentioned labels.

Example: user comes and says I want find widget in debug console
I put the following labels: `"*duplicate"`, `"debug"`, `"feature request"`
Bot says "this as a duplicate ..."(same as before) + "To find the original issue follow [this query](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Adebug+label%3Afeature-request)".

title: support easy re-arranging of folded blocks
body:
I want to be able to easily reorder the definitions in a file.
I get the best overview about the structure of my file when everything is folded.
So, I want to be able to reorder the definitions (of functions, classes, etc.) in a file when it is folded.

Example:
- Open https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Microsoft/vscode/master/src/bootstrap.js in editor
- Fold All

One can easily see the classes, interface, functions.

Now I want to rearrange them. This doesn't work.

If I select a folded function (2 lines) and want to move it with the keyboard, I can use 'Move Line Down' (Alt+ArrowDown), but that will not skip over folded blocks, but run into them.

If I try to move the selected block by mouse (drag&drop), the folding gets lost.

Same for the clipboard (cut&paste).

I don't see a single way to do what I want.

title: How to hide the Restart button in the debug toolbar when attached to a process that can't be restarted?
body:
We're implementing "Attach to Process" but sometimes have no ability to re-launch the app being debugged (we don't have all the necessary info if the user launched it separately).

I can't find any way to hide the Restart button or reliably tell in the debug config provide that the request to resolve came from a restart (so we can inform the user it's not supported).

title: Debug provide capability to always show stack frame column indicator

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Issue Type: Bug In my debug extension it frequently happens that debugging stops in multiple positions within a line. That's why I heavily depend on proper debug position markers. However the handling is currently not fully satisfying: 1) For the first stop on a line the debug marker is never shown: 2) Well, not always as this image shows: , but mostly it's missing. The difference here is that in case 1) this was the first stop on that line, while for 2) we have a recursive rule, so when I step-in the debugger ends up at the first rule name (the body of a rule begins after the colon). Pretty inconsistent. The debug marker should always show unless there is no column info (however my stack traces always has column info). 3) Also within a line the marker shows up or not, depending on how a position was reached (not the position itself). _Reached the position after stepping into `identifier` and returned._ _Reached the position after stepping over `identifier`._ 4) The debug marker is not shown for non-TOS elements in a call stack and the TOS loses the marker when navigating the call stack. ![debug5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2398704/39967693-bc461884-56c0-11e8-8e33-bc023fc499cb.gif) As you can here the marker before the `identifier` rule is lost when returning after selecting other than the TOS in the stack trace. That's a pretty bad thing as you totally lose where you came from. Imagine a rule body with 20 and more sub rule invocations, spread over multiple lines, which is very common in such grammar files. I guess 1) is implemented by intention to support languages that rarely use debug stops within a line, but I beg for an option to always show the debug markers and always respect the given column value! Btw: you can see this behavior also with the TS debugger, e.g. when you debug a for-loop, which is one of the rare occasions where a debug position within a line is used. VS Code version: Code 1.23.1 (d0182c3417d225529c6d5ad24b7572815d0de9ac, 2018-05-10T16:03:31.083Z) OS version: Darwin x64 17.5.0

title: Stop script in NPM Script Explorer
body: Feature to stop desired task in NPM Script Explorer

title: cursorUndo moves the back to the start of the selection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: If I add many multiple cursors such that the first cursor has scrolled off the top of the screen, when I then use undoCursor to remove the last cursor, the window jumps back to show the first cursor in the middle of the screen. This makes it really hard to undo multiple cursors as I have to keep scrolling back to the last one.  Really the scroll position should stay where it is, or scroll to where the previous last cursor is.

title: Setting to ignore whitespace-only lines
Add theme key for the "alternating" row color in keybindings editor/settings UI and change default

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

title: Request: Add an option for an undo/redo time interval
body:
Right now, I find the time interval that groups changes together for the "undo" to be far too granular. In other words, I find myself doing a cmd+z for one character at a time instead of an entire word.

It would be nice to be able to define the time interval for what groups these changes together. I know Atom has an option for exactly this.

title: [Emmet] Include should be more like DocumentSelector

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Currently, the Emmet extension has a setting called `emmet.includeLanguages` which just targets language IDs to map to the Emmet-capable language ID. I think it would be very useful if instead you could use something more like `DocumentSelector`, which also allows [`DocumentFilter`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#DocumentFilter) instead of just language ID.

title: Show selection settings widget when text is selected
body:
I'm not sure what the official name for the widget is, but I'm talking about the little panel that appears when pressing `Command-D`, etc.:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3943692/39827701-a7f25cac-53b0-11e8-84f4-8279aecd80b5.png)
Often I want to see what settings I have for selecting text before pressing `Command-D` (to make sure it's what I want, if the next selection is off-screen, for instance). However, the widget only appears after making a selection, by which time it's too late.

Is there an option to make the widget appear whenever any text is selected? It's unobtrusive, so I'd prefer to always display it when text is selected (so it wouldn't disappear either after a few seconds).

(Sorry if this has already been asked — it's really hard to search for things without knowing their name.)

title: Scrolling using a Surface Dial will only ever scroll in one editor group.
body:
Issue Type: Bug The Surface Dial seems to only work on one editor group. If you have two or more editor groups, the dial will only scroll in one of them. Even if you switch focus to another editor group, the first group is the only editor group that will scroll. It should follow the focus. ## Steps to reproduce 1. Open a file in the editor. 2. Open a second file in a new editor group. So you have two files open side by side. 3. Focus the first file, and then use a Surface Dial to scroll up and down. 4. Focus the second file, and then use a Surface Dial to scroll up and down. ## Expected Result: * When the first file is focused, scrolling with the Surface Dial should scroll the first file up and down. * When the second file is focused, scrolling with the Surface Dial should scroll the second file up and down. ## Actual Result: * When the first file is focused, scrolling with the Surface Dial scrolls the first file. * When the second file is focused, scrolling with the Surface Dial still scrolls the first file. * You can only scroll the first file using the dial. It's not respecting the focus. Happens with `--disable-extensions`. title: Clarify activeParameter in SignatureHelp
body: `activeParameter` is currently speced to be only valid on the active signature. However we use it as well if the users scrolls through signature options to highlight the active parameter. We should adjust the doc accordingly and we might want to consider whether signartures that have less number of parameters than the active parameter should be filtered.

title: When middle mouse button selected ends on empty line, clipboard is pasted
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.23.0
- OS Version: Linux version 4.16.5-1-ARCH

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure you have X middle mouse button pasting enabled
2. Start middle mouse button column selection on any line
3. Stop with mouse cursor on empty line
4. X's paste event is not handled or something and clipboard is pasted at each cursor

Stopping at non-empty line works as expected though. Actually I am not sure which behavior is correct, but I believe it should not differ depending on last line's content.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Feature request: sublime-style cursor movement
body:
The arrow key behavior is different between ST and Code, and the ST style arrow key when select text is more effective, so I request the ST-style cursor movement of the arrow key behavior.

Gif preview:

![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11363529/39801789-e480d840-539e-11e8-8752-86e25628525c.gif)

title: IAction#radio isn't a model property
body: https://github.com//Microsoft/vscode/commit/c24868168f4ef8a59dcc69b27b988c426f4d70ed added `IAction#radio`  but it's being used like `checked`. What is that for? Doesn't radio mean only one of some actions in a group can be *checked*?

title: Option to not style rendered whitespace with TextEditorDecorationType

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Feature Request When whitespace is rendered, and a style is applied to the text of the current line, I would like to not have that font style applied to the rendered whitespace (tabs and spaces) in that line. ## Use Case: Some extensions add text styles for certain types of comments. The two I know of are "Better Comments" and "TODO Highlight". When you apply a style to an entire comment line, say to style a `# WARNING: ...` line as bright red, the rendered whitespace also turns bright red, which adds noise to the comment. VS Code version: Code 1.23.0 (7c7da59c2333a1306c41e6e7b68d7f0caa7b3d45, 2018-05-03T15:23:14.634Z) OS version: Darwin x64 17.4.0

title: Feature Request: Allow user to override contributes made by extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Be able to control or custom contributes made by extensions (maybe in the info-page of each installed extension), such as disable button in editor title, item in context menu.
This feature will make interface clear after install many extensions.

And further more, may be we could let user custom contributes to interface in a setting file.

title: Visual Studio Code should honor a editor.fontSize value smaller than 8

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
No matter how small you set "editor.fontSize" in visual studio code, it doesn't actually render any smaller than the "8" size. Go ahead, try "5" or "6" - it will just display the "8" size.

I'd really like to push my retina screen to the max and be able to pick smaller fontSizes – with a good pair of magnifying reading glasses or loupes, you can easily read smaller sizes. Super-small font sizes are incredibly helpful when working with a split editor on a laptop.

title: macOS error after restart after battery empty
body:
Issue Type: Bug Open one or several folders in Visual Studio Code and let the battery go empty on a Macbook. After plugging in power and turning on the Macbook, the Mac restarts (not proceeds) and reopens all open applications and restores their documents. Visual Studio Code launches with an error (not further specified) and no windows are restored.
